JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . Since DATE the applicant rented an apartment owned by the GPE .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the building in which the apartment was situated was damaged with the result that it was formally declared to be no longer fit for habitation . The GPE therefore decided to provide all the inhabitants with other accommodation .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicant requested the GPE on numerous occasions to provide her with other accommodation , but to no avail .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against the LOC . On DATE ORG granted the application and ordered that the applicant be provided with alternative accommodation . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG and the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . Since the final judgment was not complied with by the LOC , the applicant lodged an action with ORG seeking a change in the manner in which the enforcement of the judgment was to be carried out . In particular , she claimed money from the GPE in lieu of alternative accommodation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant 's action and ordered the GPE to pay her the price of the apartment in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) . However , that decision was also not enforced . On DATE the applicant lodged her application with the ORG , complaining of the non - enforcement of the judgment of DATE . On DATE , ORG quashed the judgment of DATE following a revision request lodged by the ORG and reinstated the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . The judgment of DATE has not been enforced to date and the applicant continues to live in her old apartment .
CARDINAL . According to the Government an apartment building in which the applicant 's apartment will be located is currently under construction by GPE .
